title: Nigeria police says to boost security at embassies, foreign businesses
text:
Security men are seen at the gate of Jabi Lake mall in Utako, Abuja, Nigeria September 4, 2019. REUTERS/Afolabi Sotunde

LAGOS (Reuters) - Nigerian police plan to boost security at embassies and foreign businesses in the country in the wake of violence targeted at South African-owned companies, the police said on Wednesday.

Violence erupted in Nigeria against South African companies in retaliation for attacks on Nigerians and other Africans in South Africa aimed at foreign-owned businesses.

MTN, and Shoprite closed their stores in Nigeria on Wednesday.
